header.title: Zilliz Cloud Pricing
header.description: Scalable pricing designed for every team to fit any budget. <0>Estimate Cost</0>

estimator.title: Estimate Your Cost
estimator.desc: Use this calculator to understand how Zilliz Cloud charges.
estimator.tooltip: A compute unit (CU) is the physical resource unit for database deployment. Different CU types comprise varying combinations of CPU, memory, and storage. Performance-optimized CU is suitable for low latency or high throughput similarity search. Capacity-optimized CU can serve data volume 5x larger than performance-optimized CU but at the cost of higher search latency.
estimator.tip: To use the advanced CU calculator, please view the website on a desktop or tablet.

calculator.title: CU Calculator
calculator.desc: Use our comprehensive CU calculator to estimate your CU usage and cost after the free trial ends.
calculator.tip: The value of the vector dimension should be greater than 32.
calculator.resultTip: <0>Our pricing calculator is built around vectors. The calculation result may differ if your dataset includes non-vector fields (such as int, string, json, etc.)</0>. If your application is capacity-sensitive, we suggest you conduct a proof of concept (PoC) test during the free trial period.
calculator.largeSize: It looks like you are working on a large amount of data. <0></0>Please contact us directly for a cost estimate.

desc.typeOne: <0>Performance-optimized CU</0> suits low latency or high throughput similarity searches. This option works best for high-search performance scenarios.
desc.typeTwo: <0>Capacity-optimized CU</0> suits data volumes that are 5 times larger than the performance-optimized CU but at the cost of higher search latency. This option works best for increased storage capacity scenarios.
desc.typeThree: <0>Cost-optimized CU</0> provides the same large capacity as the Capacity-optimized option, but at a lower cost with reduced search performance. This option is ideal for budget-conscious projects that need ample storage without high-performance demands.

tooltip.cuType: A compute unit (CU) is the physical resource unit for database deployment. Different CU types comprise varying combinations of CPU, memory, and storage. Performance-optimized CU is suitable for low latency or high throughput similarity search. Capacity-optimized CU can serve data volume 5x larger than performance-optimized CU but at the cost of higher search latency.
tooltip.fieldType: The data type of the items in each field.
tooltip.index: Choose whether to create an index on this field or not.
tooltip.dimension: The dimension of your vector data. The upper limit is 32,768.
tooltip.averageLength: The average length of the string data. The upper limit is 65,535.

serverless.desc: The simplest way to experience a fully-managed vector database.
features: No credit card required to start

standard.desc: For teams with less than 5 engineers and complex workloads.

hardWare.hardWareOne: Cost-optimized CU, Capacity-optimized CU, and Performance-optimized CU options. <0>See comparison</0>

features: No credit card required to start
Persistent data storage, configurable snapshots, and flexible retention policies ($0.025/GB/month)

support.supportOne: Email support during business hours with <0>response time SLAs</0> (Urgent: 4 hours; High: 1 business day; Normal: 2 business days)

security: Enterprise-grade encryption in transit and at rest

enterprise.desc: For at-scale organizations with advanced security and support needs.

hardWare.hardWareOne: Cost-optimized CU, Capacity-optimized CU, and Performance-optimized CU options. <0>See comparison</0>

features: Data backups every 24 hours, retained for 7 days

support.supportOne: 24/7/365 Email and Slack support with <0>response time SLAs</0> (Urgent: 1 hour; High: 4 hours; Normal: 1 business day)

security: Enterprise-grade encryption in transit and at rest

selfHost.price: Perfect for businesses prioritizing privacy and regulatory adherence.
selfHost.desc: This plan includes all the features in the Enterprise Plan, providing self-managed vector database services deployed within your Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).
features: Deploy on your infrastructure of choice, across multiple cloud platforms

standard.urgent: These are critical problems that require immediate attention, as they significantly impact the functionality or availability of the service. Examples include: <0>Cluster unavailability</0> <0>Frequent/recurring errors that impact functionality.</0>
standard.high: High-priority issues are those that cause service quality degradation. Examples include: <0>Performance degradation of Zilliz Cloud services.</0> <0>Non-critical errors that do not significantly impact functionality.</0>
standard.normal: Normal-priority issues usually involve non-urgent matters related to the functionality or user experience of the service. Examples include:<0>General user support requests, such as assistance with configuration.</0> <0>Feature requests or enhancements to improve the service.</0> <0>Minor bugs or inconsistencies that don't impact overall performance or functionality.</0>

enterprise.urgent: These are critical problems that require immediate attention, as they significantly impact the functionality or availability of the service. Examples include: <0>Cluster unavailability</0> <0>Frequent/recurring errors that impact functionality.</0>
enterprise.high: High-priority issues are those that cause service quality degradation. Examples include: <0>Performance degradation of Zilliz Cloud services. </0> <0>Non-critical errors that do not significantly impact functionality.</0>
enterprise.normal: Normal-priority issues usually involve non-urgent matters related to the functionality or user experience of the service. Examples include:<0>General user support requests, such as assistance with configuration.</0> <0>Feature requests or enhancements to improve the service.</0> <0>Minor bugs or inconsistencies that don't impact overall performance or functionality.</0>
